title: Implement Controls and MiniMap components
description: Create reusable Lit components for the standard xyflow Controls and MiniMap.

title: Example: Inspector Designer with live JSON sync
description:
Implement a comprehensive example in examples/designer/ that showcases LitFlow as an authoring tool.
1. Dual-Pane Layout: A visual canvas alongside a collapsible JSON Inspector.
2. Live Sync: Use LitFlow events to update the JSON view as nodes are moved or edges are created.
3. Two-way Binding (Stretch): Allow manual edits in the JSON panel to reflect instantly on the visual canvas.
4. Ergonomics: Add 'Copy to Clipboard' for the resulting configuration.

title: Investigate and implement Edge Labels
description: Determine the best approach for rendering labels on edges in LitFlow. This likely involves calculating the path midpoint and rendering a foreignObject or a text element in the SVG namespace.

title: Example: Validation
description: Implement connection validation logic to prevent invalid edges between nodes.

title: Example: Subflows (Parent/Child)
description: Showcase parent-child node relationships and nested flows.

title: Designer: Implement Property Inspector
description:
Upgrade the Inspector panel to support a 'Properties' mode.
1. Listen for 'selection-change' events.
2. When a node is selected, show form fields for: Label, ID, Type, Position (X/Y).
3. Two-way bind these fields to the graph instance immediately.
4. Provide a tab/toggle to switch between 'Properties' and 'Raw JSON'.

title: Investigate and implement Edge Labels
description: Update _renderEdge in lit-flow.ts to support labels. Use the labelX and labelY coordinates returned by xyflow path utilities (getBezierPath, etc.) to render a <text> element or <foreignObject> for the label.

title: Project Documentation System (Eleventy + Diataxis + gh-pages)
description: Setup a professional documentation site using Eleventy, following the Diataxis framework, hosted on GitHub Pages with live LitFlow examples.

title: Initialize Eleventy project in docs/
description: Setup package.json, .eleventy.js, and base layouts in docs/src.

title: Migrate and structure docs using Diataxis
description: Organize existing docs into Tutorials, How-to Guides, Reference, and Explanation.

title: Implement Live Example integration
description: Enable hosting of live, non-iframed LitFlow components within Eleventy pages.

title: Configure GitHub Actions Deployment
description: Setup CI/CD to deploy to litflow.dev on push to main.

title: Draft Welcome Landing Page
description: Create the index.md for the docs using the project vision from GEMINI.md.

title: Example: Graphviz to LitFlow
description: Implement a parser and layout engine (e.g. using dagre or d3-graphviz) to convert Graphviz DOT files into LitFlow nodes and edges.

title: Example: Dynamic Interactivity (Add/Remove)
description: Add UI controls to dynamically add or remove nodes and edges from the flow.

title: Example: Overview
description: A comprehensive example mirroring the xyflow Overview, showing nodes, edges, controls, and minimap in a single view.

title: Breadboard Integration & Graph OS Analysis
description: Analyze Breadboard architecture to guide LitFlow's evolution into a lightweight 'Graph OS' interface. Focus on Schema-driven nodes, execution models, and GenAI integration.

title: Visual Polish: Edge Markers
description: Investigate why arrowheads point down on short connections or specific handle positions. Adjust marker orientation or Bezier control points.

title: Benchmark @state vs Signals for large graphs
description: Compare performance of the standard Lit state approach vs Signals with 1000+ nodes.

title: Configurable Node Naming on Drop
description: Add a property to LitFlow or a hook in the drop event to optionally prompt the user for a node label immediately after dropping.

title: Setup examples/ directory and base runner
description: Create the examples/ directory and a simple HTML/JS runner to switch between different flow examples.

title: Example: File Uploader Component
description: Create a Material 3 styled file uploader component for AI nodes, supporting drag-and-drop and file type filtering.

title: Example: Custom Edges (Step/SmoothStep)
description: Implement different edge types like Step and SmoothStep using xyflow system utilities.

title: Example: Drag & Drop Preview
description: Enhance the Drag & Drop experience with a 'ghost' node preview that follows the cursor during the dragover event.

title: Analysis: Phase 3 - GenAI & Gemini Integration
description:
Investigate how Breadboard handles GenAI specific features.
1. Analyze 'isLLMContentBehavior' and node rendering for AI.
2. Study prompt management and schema inference.
3. Propose a <lit-gemini-node> architecture that matches Breadboard capabilities.

title: Designer: Integrate Drag & Drop Palette
description:
Add a sidebar palette to examples/designer based on examples/drag-and-drop. 
1. Add draggable node templates (Input, Default, Output).
2. Update grid layout to accommodate the palette (Left) + Canvas (Center) + Inspector (Right).
3. Ensure drop events correctly create nodes with defaults.

title: Generative AI Workflow Components
description: Epic for building robust core and Generative AI flow builder components to sequence prompt executions (text-to-text, text-to-image) for visual agent-based workflows.

title: Example: Custom Nodes with Lit templates
description: Showcase how to use Lit's html templating to create custom node content and styles.

title: Example: Prompt Text Entry Component
description: Create a Material 3 styled text entry component for AI prompt nodes, supporting multi-line input and auto-resize.

title: Packaging and Distribution
description: Configure the project for distribution as an NPM package. Set up build exports, types, and a minified bundle to allow easy reuse in other projects.

title: Implement Edge Markers (Arrowheads)
description: Add support for SVG markers (arrowheads, circles) on edges using MarkerType and markerEnd/markerStart properties.

title: Designer: Canvas Actions Toolbar
description:
Add a floating toolbar or header actions for:
1. 'Delete Selected' (Visual alternative to Backspace)
2. 'Clear Graph' (Reset to empty)
3. 'Fit View' (Trigger fitView method)
4. 'Help/Shortcuts' modal trigger.

title: Validate and Debug Marquee Selection reliability
description: Follow-up on litflow-ucl to ensure Shift+Drag selection is reliable and visual feedback is consistent across all environments.

title: Style lit-node with Material 3
description: Update lit-node to use M3 Card styles, including proper elevation and states (hover, selected).

title: Implement Keyboard Interactivity
description: Add support for keyboard shortcuts: Delete/Backspace to remove elements, Arrow keys to nudge nodes, and Ctrl/Cmd+A to select all.

title: Example: Multiple Handles/Ports
description: Demonstrate nodes with multiple source and target handles/ports.

title: Designer: Edge Configuration UI
description:
Add Edge-specific controls to the Property Inspector.
1. When an edge is selected, allow editing:
   - Label (Text input)
   - Type (Select: default, straight, step, smoothstep)
   - Markers (Checkbox: ArrowHead)
   - Animated (Checkbox)

title: Analysis: Phase 2 - Graph Execution (The Core)
description:
Investigate how Breadboard executes graphs. 
1. Study MutableGraphStore and GraphDescriptor in packages/types.
2. Analyze the Runner/Runtime in packages/visual-editor.
3. Determine how to hook LitFlow visual states to a headless Breadboard runtime.

title: Refactor store.ts to use @lit-labs/signals
description: Convert nodes, edges, and transform to signals to enable fine-grained reactivity.

title: Implement M3-styled Sidebar for Drag & Drop
description: Create a node palette sidebar using M3 Navigation Rail or Drawer patterns.

title: Example: Media Display Component
description: Create a Material 3 styled media display component for AI nodes, supporting image, audio, and video playback/preview.

title: Example: Static Documentation Display
description: Create an example of a read-only graph for documentation. Disable panning, zooming, and dragging, but maintain support for group expand/collapse interactivity.

title: Example: Gemini AI Nodes (Prompt & Image)
description: Create custom nodes for AI workflows: a Prompt node for text input and an Image node that displays generated results using Gemini 3 Flash/Pro Image.

title: Implement SignalWatcher in lit-node and lit-edge
description: Update components to use the SignalWatcher mixin for automatic re-renders on signal changes.

title: Implement Change-based Updates (applyNodeChanges)
description: Refactor node/edge updates to use the applyNodeChanges/applyEdgeChanges pattern for better performance in large graphs.

title: Example: Drag & Drop
description: Implement a drag and drop interface to add nodes from a sidebar to the flow canvas.

title: Establish Material 3 Design System
description: Define M3 design tokens (colors, typography, elevation) and a base theme for LitFlow components.

title: Example: Node Resizer & Toolbar
description: Showcase the NodeResizer and NodeToolbar utilities within Lit components.

title: Implement M3-styled Controls component
description: Create a floating control panel using M3 IconButton and Surface components.

title: Style lit-handle with Material 3
description: Update lit-handle to use M3 color tokens and add subtle animations for connection states.

title: Example: Save & Restore
description: Demonstrate how to serialize the flow state to JSON and restore it later.

title: Example: Gemini AI Workflow Builder
description:
Create a dedicated example in examples/ai-workflow/ that demonstrates a functional Gemini-based flow.
1. Use lit-gemini-prompt-node and lit-gemini-image-node.
2. Implement a mock or real backend to 'execute' the flow (sequencing text to image).
3. Add visual execution state (loading, success, error) to nodes.

title: Integrate Lit Signals for state management
description: Perform pro/con analysis and integrate @lit-labs/signals to handle fine-grained reactivity for nodes, edges, and viewport transform. This will replace the current @state-based approach in Phase 2 (Controls & MiniMap).

title: Implement Marquee Selection
description: Add a selection box (marquee) to allow users to select multiple nodes by dragging on the canvas background.

title: Implement Snap to Grid
description: Add a snap-to-grid property that aligns node positions to a configurable grid size during dragging.

title: Investigate and fix node jumping on subsequent drags
description: Ensure node positions and internals are perfectly synced between drags to prevent offsets.

title: Tutorial: Building Static Documentation with LitFlow
description: Create a step-by-step tutorial (e.g., TUTORIAL.md) showing how to use LitFlow for static documentation, including disabling interactivity and custom group toggles.

title: Implement Advanced FitView
description: Add a fitView method that calculates the bounds of all nodes and centers the viewport with optional padding and animation.

title: Create Drag & Drop Guide
description: Write a guide in docs/src/guides/drag-and-drop.md explaining how to implement palette-to-canvas interactions.

title: Implement Mock Runner
description: Create src/breadboard/runner.ts to simulate HarnessRunner interface.

title: Implement Real LitFlowRunner
description: Create a runner that uses the vendored Breadboard Harness. 1. Wrap PlanRunner. 2. Bind Harness events to LitFlow node data.

title: Example: Basic Flow
description: A basic flow example with standard nodes and edges to demonstrate the core Lit integration.

title: Implement manual edge connections
description: Wire up XYHandle.onPointerDown to allow users to drag connections between handles and create new edges.

title: Implement project method in LitFlow
description: Add a public 'project' method to LitFlow that converts screen coordinates to canvas coordinates using the current viewport transform. This is essential for Drag & Drop and context menus.

title: Migrate from npm to pnpm
description: Switch to pnpm for better dependency management and alignment with the xyflow project.

title: Implement LitSchemaNode
description: Create a new node type that renders ports dynamically based on Breadboard Schema. 1. Accept schema as property. 2. Render dynamic handles.
